text: Map of civil parish of Sutton within the former borough of Vale Royal Sutton Weaver (formerly just Sutton) is a civil parish in the unitary authority of Cheshire West and Chester and the ceremonial county of Cheshire, in the north west of England. The population taken at the 2011 census was 495. It lies to the north east of Frodsham and contains the village of Sutton Weaver. The parish was renamed in April 2015 after a review of town and parish councils in the Cheshire West and Chester unitary authority. At the same time a small amount of land in the west of the parish was given up to Frodsham.Compendium of Decision Notices, Cheshire West and Chester unitary authority, 28 November 2014. p. 148 The parish should not be confused with a different Cheshire parish called Sutton, in Cheshire East. ==See also== *Listed buildings in Sutton, Cheshire West and Chester ==References== Category:Civil parishes in Cheshire Category:Cheshire West and Chester
title: Sutton Weaver (civil parish)
